sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"变化，改变"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: change, alter, vary, convert, modify, transform, turn
means: change ： 指任何变化，完全改变，强调与原先的情况有明显的不同。
alter ： 常指轻微的改变，强调基本上保持原物、原状的情况下所进行的部分改变。
vary ： 暗示不规则或断断续续地变。
convert ： 指进行全部或局部改变以适应新的功能或用途。指信仰或态度时，强调较激烈、大的改变。
modify ： 强调起限定作用的变化或变更。指细小的变化，常含"缓和、降调"的意味。
transform ： 指人或物在形状、外观、形式、性质等方面发生的彻底变化，失去原状成为全新的东西。
turn ： 指外形、颜色、气味、性质等方面的变化，比change更通俗。

sentence.Network_en: These large institutions make — and change—the rules to suit themselves.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些大机构总是随意制定规定，而且说变就变。

sentence.Network_en: 1998 was an important year for everyone: a time of change.
sentence.Network_cn: 1998年对所有人来说都是重要的一年：那是个变革的时期。

sentence.Network_en: Eisenhower used his muscle to persuade Congress to change the law.
sentence.Network_cn: 艾森豪威尔用他的影响力说服国会修改了该项法律。

jx.jx_en_mean: To alternate with another person in performing a task.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 交替：与他人交替做同一份工作

jx.jx_en_mean: To perform two tasks at once by alternating or a single task by alternate means.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 轮流：同时做两项任务时交替着做或以交替的方式做一项工作

phrase.cizu_name: a change is as good as a rest

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)a change of work or occupation can be as restorative or refreshing as a period of relaxation
adopt a different opinion or plan
a different climate, typically as means of improving one's health
jx.jx_cn_mean: 改换环境（多指易地疗养）

jx.jx_en_mean: a move to a different opinion or attitude
alter one's step so that the opposite leg is the one that marks time when marching
begin talking of something different, especially to avoid embarrassment
jx.jx_cn_mean: （尤指为避免尴尬而）转换话题

jx.jx_en_mean: express a very different opinion or behave in a very different way, especially in response to a change in circumstances
jx.jx_cn_mean: （尤指为适应情况变化而）改口（或改变做法），见风使舵

jx.jx_en_mean: contrary to how things usually happen or in order to introduce variety
jx.jx_cn_mean: 与惯常相反；为了变变花样

means.word_mean: 零钱
改变;交换;变化;变更
其他释义
变化,变更
其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French change (noun), changer (verb), from late Latin cambiare, from Latin cambire 'barter', probably of Celtic origin

entry.def: If there is a change in something, it becomes different.

example.ex: The ambassador appealed for a change in US policy...
example.tran: 大使呼吁美国在政策上作出改变。

example.ex: What is needed is a change of attitude on the part of architects...
example.tran: 现在需要的是建筑师态度的转变。

entry.def: If you say that something is a change or makes a change, you mean that it is enjoyable because it is different from what you are used to.

example.ex: It is a complex system, but it certainly makes a change...
example.tran: 这是个复杂的体系，不过确实有所改变。

example.ex: Do you feel like you could do with a change?
example.tran: 你想不想改变一下？

entry.def: If you change from one thing to another, you stop using or doing the first one and start using or doing the second.

example.ex: His doctor increased the dosage but did not change to a different medication...
example.tran: 他的医生加大了剂量，不过没有换药。

example.ex: He changed from voting against to abstaining.
example.tran: 他原打算投反对票，后来改为弃权了。

entry.def: When something changes or when you change it, it becomes different.

example.ex: We are trying to detect and understand how the climates change...
example.tran: 我们正努力探寻并理解气候是如何变化的。

example.ex: In the union office, the mood gradually changed from resignation to rage...
example.tran: 在工会办公室，情绪慢慢从顺从转变成愤怒。

entry.def: To change something means to replace it with something new or different.

example.ex: I paid £80 to have my car radio fixed and I bet all they did was change a fuse...
example.tran: 我花80英镑让人把我车上的收音机修了修，可我敢肯定，他们只是换了根保险丝。

example.ex: If you want to change your doctor there are two ways of doing it.
example.tran: 你要是想换个医生，办法有两个。

entry.def: When you change your clothes or change, you take some or all of your clothes off and put on different ones.

example.ex: Ben had merely changed his shirt...
example.tran: 本仅仅换了件衬衫。

example.ex: They had allowed her to shower and change...
example.tran: 他们准许她冲个澡，换套衣裳。

entry.def: A change of clothes is an extra set of clothes that you take with you when you go to stay somewhere or to take part in an activity.

example.ex: He stuffed a bag with a few changes of clothing.
example.tran: 他往包里塞了几套换洗衣服。

entry.def: When you change a bed or change the sheets, you take off the dirty sheets and put on clean ones.

example.ex: After changing the bed, I would fall asleep quickly...
example.tran: 换了床单，我很快就能睡着。

example.ex: I changed the sheets on your bed today.
example.tran: 我今天把你的床单换了。

entry.def: When you change a baby or change its nappy or diaper, you take off the dirty one and put on a clean one.

example.ex: She criticizes me for the way I feed or change him...
example.tran: 她批评我不会给他喂奶、不会换尿布。

example.ex: He needs his nappy changed.
example.tran: 他的尿布该换了。

entry.tran: 转乘，换乘(交通工具);转车;转机
entry.def: When you change buses, trains, or planes or change, you get off one bus, train, or plane and get on to another in order to continue your journey.

example.ex: At Glasgow I changed trains for Greenock...
example.tran: 我在格拉斯哥改乘去格里诺克的火车。

example.ex: We were turned off the train at Hanover, where we had to change.
example.tran: 我们在汉诺威站被赶下火车，只好在那儿转车。

entry.def: When you change gear or change into another gear, you move the gear lever on a car, bicycle, or other vehicle in order to use a different gear.

example.ex: The driver tried to change gear, then swerved...
example.tran: 司机试图换挡，接着突然转向。

example.ex: He looked up into the mirror as he changed through his gears.
example.tran: 他一边换挡，一边抬眼看后视镜。

entry.def: Your change is the money that you receive when you pay for something with more money than it costs because you do not have exactly the right amount of money.

example.ex: 'There's your change.' — 'Thanks very much.'...
example.tran: “您的找头。”——“多谢。”

example.ex: They told the shopkeeper to keep the change.
example.tran: 他们告诉店主不用找钱了。

entry.def: Change is coins, rather than paper money.

example.ex: Thieves ransacked the office, taking a sack of loose change...
example.tran: 窃贼洗劫了办公室，拿走了一口袋散币。

example.ex: The man in the store won't give him change for the phone unless he buys something.
example.tran: 店里的人不肯给他换硬币打电话，除非他买点什么。

entry.def: If you have change for larger notes, bills, or coins, you have the same value in smaller notes, bills, or coins, which you can give to someone in exchange.

example.ex: The courier had change for a £10 note.
example.tran: 快递员能破开10英镑的纸币。

entry.def: When you change money, you exchange it for the same amount of money in a different currency, or in smaller notes, bills, or coins.

example.ex: You can expect to pay the bank a fee of around 1% to 2% every time you change money...
example.tran: 每次到银行换币都会要求付1%到2%的手续费。

example.ex: If you travel frequently, find an agency that will change one foreign currency directly into another.
example.tran: 如果经常旅行，找一家能直接兑换外币的旅行社。

entry.def: If you say that you are doing something or something is happening for a change, you mean that you do not usually do it or it does not usually happen, and you are happy to be doing it or that it is happening.

example.ex: Now let me ask you a question, for a change...
example.tran: 现在换我来问你一个问题吧。

example.ex: Liz settled back in her seat, comfortably relaxed, enjoying being driven for a change.
example.tran: 莉兹舒服放松地倚在座位上，享受着换别人开车的惬意。

means.word_mean: 1. an event that occurs when something passes from one state or phase to another;

sentences.sentence: "the change was intended to increase sales"
"this storm is certainly a change for the worse"
"the neighborhood had undergone few modifications since his last visit years ago"

means.word_mean: 2. a relational difference between states; especially between states before and after some event;

sentences.sentence: "he attributed the change to their marriage"

means.word_mean: 3. the action of changing something;

sentences.sentence: "the change of government had no impact on the economy"
"his change on abortion cost him the election"

means.word_mean: 4. the result of alteration or modification;

sentences.sentence: "there were marked changes in the lining of the lungs"
"there had been no change in the mountains"

means.word_mean: 5. the balance of money received when the amount you tender is greater than the amount due;

sentences.sentence: "I paid with a twenty and pocketed the change"

means.word_mean: 6. a thing that is different;

sentences.sentence: "he inspected several changes before selecting one"

means.word_mean: 7. a different or fresh set of clothes;

sentences.sentence: "she brought a change in her overnight bag"

means.word_mean: 8. coins of small denomination regarded collectively;

sentences.sentence: "he had a pocketful of change"

means.word_mean: 9. money received in return for its equivalent in a larger denomination or a different currency;

sentences.sentence: "he got change for a twenty and used it to pay the taxi driver"

means.word_mean: 10. a difference that is usually pleasant;

sentences.sentence: "he goes to France for variety"
"it is a refreshing change to meet a woman mechanic"

means.word_mean: 1. undergo a change; become different in essence; losing one's or its original nature;

sentences.sentence: "She changed completely as she grew older"
"The weather changed last night"

means.word_mean: 2. cause to change; make different; cause a transformation;

sentences.sentence: "The advent of the automobile may have altered the growth pattern of the city"
"The discussion has changed my thinking about the issue"

means.word_mean: 3. make or become different in some particular way, without permanently losing one's or its former characteristics or essence;

sentences.sentence: "her mood changes in accordance with the weather"
"The supermarket's selection of vegetables varies according to the season"

means.word_mean: 4. lay aside, abandon, or leave for another;

sentences.sentence: "switch to a different brand of beer"
"She switched psychiatrists"
"The car changed lanes"

means.word_mean: 5. change clothes; put on different clothes;

sentences.sentence: "Change before you go to the opera"

means.word_mean: 6. exchange or replace with another, usually of the same kind or category;

sentences.sentence: "Could you convert my dollars into pounds?"
"He changed his name"
"convert centimeters into inches"
"convert holdings into shares"

means.word_mean: 7. give to, and receive from, one another;

sentences.sentence: "Would you change places with me?"
"We have been exchanging letters for a year"

means.word_mean: 8. change from one vehicle or transportation line to another;

sentences.sentence: "She changed in Chicago on her way to the East coast"

means.word_mean: 9. become deeper in tone;

sentences.sentence: "His voice began to change when he was 12 years old"
"Her voice deepened when she whispered the password"

means.word_mean: 10. remove or replace the coverings of;

sentences.sentence: "Father had to learn how to change the baby"
"After each guest we changed the bed linens"

example.en: It takes a lot of change to buy a car like that.
example.zh: 买一辆那样的汽车要花费好多钱。

example.en: Would you mind giving him a change?
example.zh: 你带个好消息给他，好吗？

auth_sentence.content: It doesn't really change what I'm doing.
auth_sentence.res_content: It doesn't really change what I'm doing.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It doesn't really change what I'm doing.

auth_sentence.content: We can't change this situation in one year.
auth_sentence.res_content: We can't change this situation in one year.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We can't change this situation in one year.

auth_sentence.content: The change was suggested by the Electoral Commission watchdog.
auth_sentence.res_content: The change was suggested by the Electoral Commission watchdog.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The change was suggested by the Electoral Commission watchdog.

means.word_mean: 改变, 改换; 变化

sentences.en: Flyovers have changed the face of the city.
sentences.cn: 立交桥改变了城市的面貌。

means.word_mean: 换衣服, 换车

sentences.en: Passengers to Shanghai will change at this station into another train.
sentences.cn: 到上海的旅客在此站换车。

means.word_mean: 兑换(货币)

sentences.en: I wish to change some pocket money.
Will you change me five ten-pound notes?
sentences.cn: 你给我换五张十英镑的纸钞好吗?

means.word_mean: 改变, 变化, 变更

sentences.en: Many old people find it difficult to cope with change.
sentences.cn: 许多老人难以适应变化。

means.word_mean: 交换，互换；转换

sentences.en: He wanted to change from Physics to Chemistry.
sentences.cn: 他想从学物理转学化学。

means.word_mean: 改期

sentences.en: The conference has changed to October 31st.

jushi.english: I need some change to take the bus.
jushi.chinese: 我需要些零钱乘公共汽车。

jushi.english: I have noticed a great change in him lately.
jushi.chinese: 我已注意到他最近有很大的变化。

jushi.english: The college gave advance notice of the change of the date of our sports meeting.
jushi.chinese: 学院已事先通知我们运动会改期。
